page.title: 10The Big Tree
page.content: The tallest tree in Great Britain is at Cairndow in the gardens which are owned by Lady Glenkinglas.Her husband Lord Glenkinglas died last year.They were the main founders of the gardens.The gardens stretch from the Rest and Be Thankful to the shores of Loch Fyne.Part of the gardens is called a Pinetum because that is the name for a collection of trees. The tallest tree in Britain is 200 feet high and 20 feet round the girth. It looks very imposing from any angle. The Pinetums collection of trees is quite amazing.There are dozens of rhododendrons in the walks of all different colours:white purple red pink orange and lots more.They have also got azalea bluebells daffodils and primroses.If you visit when they are in bloom you would see a spectacular display of colours.
